Answer.Description: Merit badges, badges of rank, and Eagle Palms are for registered Boy Scouts, Varsity Scouts, or qualified Venturers.

Faq.Question: What if you have Special Needs?

Answer.Description: Merit badges are awarded only when all requirements are met as stated.

Faq.Question: Can a merit badge be taken away?

Answer.Description: A merit badge cannot be taken away once it has been earned, provided the counselor is a registered counselor for the merit badge.

Faq.Question: Does a counselor "cover" the requirements or does each Scout do each requirement himself?

Answer.Description: You are expected to meet the requirements as they are stated -- no more and no less. You are expected to do exactly what is stated in the requirements. If it says "show or demonstrate," that is what you must do.
In the end, the Scout must be reviewed individually by the counselor to ensure completion of the badges requirements

Faq.Question: Can a merit badge counselor add or remove requirements

Answer.Description: No. "Merit badges are awarded only when all requirements are met as stated."
Certification must be given by the appropriate local council...

Faq.Question: What are the requirements to be a merit badge counselor? Do you have to register again? Who approves you?

Answer.Description: "Qualified: "They must be men and women of good character, age 18 or older, and recognized as having the skills and education in the subjects for which they are to serve as merit badge counselors, as well as the ability to work with Scout-age boys."
"Registered: "All Merit badge counselors must…register as a merit badge counselor…" (Code 42).
"Approved: ...they must be approved...for each specific merit badge."
"Trained: "in the aims of Scouting and in advancement procedures." and "All volunteers are expected to complete Youth Protection training...within 90 days..."
"Trained: "All volunteers are expected to complete Youth Protection training...within 90 days..."

Faq.Question: Can a merit badge counselor counsel their own son or relative?

Answer.Description: "An approved counselor can counsel any youth member, including his or her own son, ward, or relative."

Faq.Question: Can a someone under 18 teach merit badges?

Answer.Description: "Camp staff members who are qualified in the subject and are younger than age 18 may assist the merit badge counselor with instruction...However regardless of the class format, each Scout must be tested individually by the counselor to ensure completion of the badge's requirements."

Faq.Question: Should we wait until the next court of honor to present the merit badge?

Answer.Description: "Presentation of merit badges and rank badges should not wait until the next court of honor; awards and badges should be presented at the next meeting after they have been earned."
